results.title: Apollo 1
results.creator_credit: David Frankel, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.

results.title: Squarejohns
results.creator_credit: Bill Davies, Graham Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Follows the adjustment of two paroled prisoners as observed by their parole officer. One of the men, aging and tired, seems resigned to the “square” life of “the street.” He seems more in need of protection than supervision. The other is younger, more demanding of life and so more tempted. How the parole officer works to aid both through the parole period is convincingly shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Davies, Graham Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: We interrupt this program
results.creator_credit: David Frankel, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
On April 13, 1970, Apollo 13, the 23rd manned flight into space, developed problems that threatened the lives of the astronauts on board. The complacency which had accompanied the launch and the disinterest of the general public throughout the mission until problems occurred were quickly dispelled, as every move was monitored by journalists who fed the story to a hungry audience fast becoming hooked on sensationalism. A divide was growing wider between the traditions of the intellectual press and the fast-feed emotional content of the new tabloid journalism.

results.title: Spotlights: Bob Connolly
results.brief_description: An Australian film director, cinematographer and author. He is best known for his documentaries produced over the past 30 years, including The Highlands Trilogy (1983) and Rats in the Ranks (1996). More recent films include Facing the Music (2001) and Mrs Carey’s Concert (2011).

constellations_primary.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_primary.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.description: Bob Connolly is an Australian director, cinematographer and author. He’s best known for his documentaries, produced over the past 30 years, including The Highlands Trilogy (1983) and Rats in the Ranks (1996). More recent films include Facing the Music (2001) and Mrs Carey’s Concert (2011). Bob discusses the art of documentary making and acknowledging unconscious bias.
description_for_label: Bob Connolly is an Australian director, cinematographer and author. He’s best known for his documentaries, produced over the past 30 years, including The Highlands Trilogy (1983) and Rats in the Ranks (1996). More recent films include Facing the Music (2001) and Mrs Carey’s Concert (2011). Bob discusses the art of documentary making and acknowledging unconscious bias.

results.title: Springtime in a small town = Xiao cheng zhi chun
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang, Ting Yatming, Li Xiaowan, Bill Kong, China Film Group Corporation and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Finely crafted romantic drama about a young married woman who dutifully cares for her sickly husband, but whose feelings for a former beau reawakens her desire. Set amid the post-WW2 ruins of a small town, this film exquisitely portrays Yuwens longing, which contrasts with her efficient but cold care of her ailing and ill-tempered husband. Director Tian Zhuangzuang (The Blue kite), part of the fifth generation of Chinese filmmakers observes his protagonists through doorways and windows, providing an apt metaphor for their inability to connect. A film that allows the tension to build in a languid but effective manner, as the three angst ridden players make their choices. Cast includes Hu Jingfan, Wu Jun, Xin Baiqing, Ye Xiaokeng and Lu Sisi.

results.title: What makes me, me
results.creator_credit: Robbie Palm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: One of Robbie Palm’s favourite things is fishing at the creek of his nan’s property. Even though he goes to boarding school in Brisbane, he returns during school holidays to fish. He has been taught by his family the techniques and it is this, and when he plays the Didgeridoo that Robbie feels most connected to his culture. When he plays, he feels proud and watched by his family, both current and past.

results.title: Spotlights: Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: An Australian film and TV director and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed three feature-length films and two short films including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009).

constellations_primary.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_primary.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.description: Ana Kokkinos is an Australian filmmaker and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed features and two shorts including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009). Here she discusses diversity, particularly in relation to class and queerness.
description_for_label: Ana Kokkinos is an Australian filmmaker and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed features and two shorts including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009). Here she discusses diversity, particularly in relation to class and queerness.

results.title: From the earth to the moon
results.creator_credit: Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description: Produced with the cooperation of NASA, these are the stories of the men, women and children who lived and breathed the great American dream as it became reality through the voyages of the Apollo astronauts in their mission to place a man on the moon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base

results.title: Spring ball [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: At the Annual Senior Citizens Spring Ball another woman is named Spring Belle. Over the course of the evening, memories of friends lost as well as the lives that they’ve led will be shared. A powerful short film shot in Wagga about ageing with dignity and the era of Spring Dances and all they encompass. (Awards: Voted most popular Australian Short Film, Sydney Film Festival, 1993)
